'Dicarbon monoxide' (C 2O) is an extremely reactive molecule that
contains two carbon atoms and one oxygen atom. Dicarbon monoxide, covalently
bonded, is a product of the photolysis of carbon suboxide.
It is closely related to CO, CO 2 and C 3O 2, and
other oxocarbons.

:C 3O 2 â CO + C 2O

It is stable enough to observe reactions with NO and NO 2.
